name: unconquerable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
not able to be defeated, or not able to be successfully controlled or dealt with: Rebel soldiers and civilians believed Lee's army was unconquerable. She had an unconquerable aversion to modern life.
More examplesFewer examples"This disease now is almost unconquerable," according to an expert at the University of California.As if we needed a tsunami to remind us, the sea is, and will remain, an unconquerable element.The Evening News predicted that "Everest the Unconquerable" would never be climbed again.
